intro: Hypoxis spathacea, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asparagaceae and is characterized by its striking white, star-shaped flowers that open at night. The plant has a rhizomatous root system and produces small, pale green leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade. Hypoxis spathacea is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
